summary: This function creates an immutable map from another map.
returns: Return an immutable copy of the original.
example-1: module Main in execution;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    val original = new TreeMap();%0A%0A    My::add(original, 100, 11);%0A    My::add(original, 200, 12);%0A    My::add(original, 300, 13);%0A%0A    val derived = F::immutable(original is Map);%0A    %0A    My::add(original, 400, 14);%0A    My::add(original, 500, 15);%0A%0A    My::add(derived, 600, 16);%0A    My::add(derived, 700, 17);%0A%0A    F::println(%22Original: %22 .. original);%0A    F::println(%22Derived: %22 .. derived);%0A}%0A%0Adefun add (ds : Map, key : Object, value : Object) : void%0A{%0A    try%0A    {%0A        ds.put(key, value);%0A    }%0A    catch (ex : UnsupportedOperationException)%0A    {%0A        F::println(%22Failed to Add: %22 .. key);%0A    }%0A}
